full_summary:
# Tender Notice for Phase 1: Site Walkway and Pavement Repairs
## Project Overview
The Correctional Service Canada (CSC) is soliciting tenders for the rehabilitation of pedestrian walkways and other asphalt surfacing at the Edmonton Institution for Women (EIFW) in Edmonton, Alberta. The project is a two-phase process, with the first phase (Phase One) evaluating the qualifications of interested suppliers, and the second phase inviting qualified suppliers to provide a financial bid.

## Scope of Work
The scope of work includes, but is not limited to:

* Selective demolition
* Selective grading to improve drainage
* Granular base course installation
* Cold milling existing asphalt pavement
* Asphalt surfacing
* Catch basin adjustments
* Landscaping of disturbed areas

## Timeline
The tender closing date is July 09, 2024 by 14:00 EDT. All bids submitted after this time will be declared non-responsive.

## Contract Details
The contract is being administered by the Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC). The expected contract start date is August 15, 2024, and the expected contract end date is November 28, 2024.

## Procurement Requirements
Bidders will be required to adhere to CSC security requirements and submit to daily checks of tools and equipment. The contract will be awarded based on the lowest price.

## Contact Information
For more information, please contact:
Mike Fagan (SPAC/PSPC)
Email: [mike.fagan@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:mike.fagan@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)

## Notice URL
The complete tender notice can be viewed at: https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/20092621?extsite=MjAwOTI2MjFfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==
